Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had my flight scheduled for Christmas Day - looked at the app before heading to the airport, all was well. It wasn't until after dropping off my bags and getting through security did I notice an overwhelming number of people at each gates. Doubled - checked the monitor to see if there were any changes, and there was. About a 45 minute delay to my Midway connection before heading to Minneapolis-St. Paul. Maybe 20 minutes later I checked the app and it said the connection was cancelled. I did not receive a text notification that it was cancelled. Talk about lack of visibility. Tried making it easier on the airline by rebooking my own flight through the app, didn't work, tried the website, also didn't work. Kept receiving an error code. Mind you, I have no luggage on me (I checked all of it). Then, I wait 1.5 hours in the guest services line, while trying to reach their phone line to be instructed that I could've been rebooked on another flight but it "just had left"... so it was a time and place thing which could've been solved if the app or website was working, or even if I had received a notification earlier in the day. They then rebooked me for another flight for the 26th that was then cancelled at 6:30am this morning. I swear it was a ghost flight to hold people over to be disappointed another day later. It's 11:33AM and I waited on the phone for 2.5 hours to be disconnected. My luggage is in an unknown location, and I am utterly frustrated and sad. I am lucky I only have to think about myself traveling, but I can't help think about the families with children and elderly, those travelling to see their loved ones.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  I do the majority of the travel for 16 people. I, and my family are extremely upset with SW. This past year with all the canceled and delayed flights, it has been a nightmare. Most all of these flights were DAL - MCO and RT on non- stops. But we pushed through hoping it would get better, trying to understand. Birthday flights to Orlando, disastereous with seriously delayed flights. For 7 of our party. Costing us empty non refundable hotel rooms, theme park tickets and the stress of all of us not being togther for my birthday. Canceled flight for 3 trying to get to HHN at Universal Studious. Tickets bought and and a hotel room unused and non refundable. These two stick out but the worst of all, is our Christmas flights. My husband and I were set to fly to MCO on a non stop and Christmas eve as we try to check in to find I get a seat and he does not. SW split us up, and put my husband on standby with 15 people in front of him. To make matters worse, just hours before we have to drive an hour & a half to DAL cant get anyone on the Phone. We were left on eternal hold, hung up on 4 times and upon calling back received several busy signals. The bottom line, SW ruined our Christmas. Again we had non refundable hotels stays. And the memories we missed are priceless to us. AND this morning, they canceled our minor childs flight on a non stop from ATL - DAL. She was supposed to be home today but now she can't get home until Thursday. I don't need excuses about the weather. There is no weather in the south. If there is a problem where ever to Dal, pull out a plane from the hanger DAL, it is their hub. Stop over booking, Your airline has cost me $2100 in unused, non refundable rooms, $1200 in unused park tickets, and stress for our family ALL year. We missed out on happy memories to be replaced with anger and frustration. We will be closing all our SW Rapid rewards accounts, and our Chase SW Credit cards. They are no longer reliable. We can not count on Southwest Airlines for our family trips. They cost us more then money, but memories. We have an up coming flight to HNL that we are price shopping to other airlines because of their unreliability. I am just heartbroken. What happened to SW?

Reviews: Not Verified |  I purchased a ticket for my son to bring him home for the holidays. First his flight was canceled before he even left for the airport. They did rebook him on a later flight. When he did get to the airport, his flight was delayed for over three hours. They finally took off and he made it to Chicago Midway where he was supposed to connect to Salt Lake City. Fortunately his plane for connecting flight was also late. Now here is where it gets really good. It is now the middle of the night, the pilots show up, but two flight attendants have not shown up and the airline claims they cannot get hold of them. The flight crew from another airline who had their flight canceled volunteered to step in. Southwest corporate refused. One flight attendant show up but now  pilots have been too long without sleep and so canceled the flight. Now he is stranded in Chicago. What happened to the airline Southwest used to be? We will never use them again.
Route: Cincinnati to Salt Lake city via Chicago midway

Reviews: Not Verified |  We were booked direct from Bozeman, MT, to Houston, TX, on the same physical plane with the same flight number, but with a brief stop in Denver. We arrived at Denver. No one told us the plane needed maintenance and that we needed to deplane and reboard. We deduced this from the complete deplaning of passengers and, when we asked about the circumstances, were treated by SW employees like complete idiots. We managed to barely make our connecting flight and then board. I sat directly over the baggage loading bay and saw all the transfer bags, which did not include ours. My wife mentioned this to the flight and gate crew. She was, literally, verbally assaulted and told to mind her own business and shut up. Of course, we arrived in Houston without our luggage, which somehow ended up in Dallas. Our luggage finally made it to Houston airport at 2 pm the next day, after which the people contracted to deliver our luggage unloaded it at the wrong hotel. It is 24 hours later, we still haven't got our luggage, comforted only by the knowledge that it is somewhere in Houston, with indeterminate wait times on the phone trying to connect with a human being. Southwest Airlines is a caricature of a budget airline that specializes in cutting corners and offering horrific service.

Reviews: Not Verified |  I have flown faithfully with Southwest for many years and I’ve never had to cancel a flight. But my boyfriend was ill and didn’t want to expose anyone to whatever he had so we choose to cancel. When we bought our tickets it said in bold print no cancellation fee. And I looked at the small print papers and they also said no cancellation fee will be incurred. When I called to cancel the first person said there is a 200.00 dollar cancellation fee. I asked to speak to a higher person and they told me I have no choice to accept fee or lose all the money. At first I accepted it . Then I read their policy over and over and again it said no cancellation fees. I called back and spoke to someone and said this is not acceptable your policy clearly states no cancellation fees. I had to fight with this person and I told them I will see them in court and call news crews. They finally gave me back my 200.00 dollars. I still have the policy and no fees incurred on my phone. I’m disappointed that they know their policy but yet try to lie and and steal money from their clients. My boyfriend is a lawyer and I’m an educated women and had to fight for my rights. How many people have paid the fee that shouldn’t have. The airline clearly are stealing from people. The public needs to be aware of these deceptive practices. I’m sure they know what they are doing. When I called it was the same person answering and using different names. Shame on him. Shame on Southwest.

Reviews: Not Verified |  Terrible experience with zero communication. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  I liked Southwest. We booked the trip during one of their low-fare specials. We didn't experience any delays or boarding issues at all. In fact, we had a total of 4 flights (to and from our destination) and we landed about 20 minutes early for all of them. Flight attendants and gate attendants were friendly. Even the staff at the bag drop was friendly. I really think you receive the "energy" you give to people. So I greeted them with a smile and they returned with great customer service. The only thing I will say is that since there aren't different boarding classes, it can be a cramped ride. Two of our flights were booked to capacity, which means there wasn't any extra space or stretching room for your arms or legs. It can be uncomfortable. Still, the inflight movies & snacks helped to ease the "cramped space" blues. I would recommend Early-bird check-in to try to get A or B-section boarding--to accommodate your carry-on and seat preference. Some of the travelers in the C section had to check their carry-on luggage at the last minute because the A & B sections used all of the overhead bins. The airlines have a lot of no-hassle policies which I like: 2 free checked bags Free movies & live TV Decent fares Free cancellation and changes I probably wouldn't use the airlines for flights over 2 hours, just because of the seating tightness. I'm 5'4" and even I found the seats a bit squished for my liking, I felt bad for my 6'0" husband's knees and back. Other than that, I'll book again for shorter routes.

Reviews: Not Verified |  I used to be a big fan of SW. That was before they ruined our family vacation and treated us poorly. We were taking our grandchildren to the balloon festival in Albequerque when Southwest cancelled the second leg of our flight and dumped 6 of us in Houston at midnight without even telling us! My grandson saw his bag being pulled off the plane and the flight crew walked out, leaving 6 of us sitting on the plane!! We had to run after them and it was”-so sorry, call back tomorrow!” Yeah “good luck finding a hotel we can’t help”. Five of us were able to get out the next morning, but we missed the last balloon flight of the festival and spent the next day (Sunday) just trying to get home. Oh yeah, we got a $100 voucher per ticket ($400). The hotel we finally found at 1 am cost more than that plus the hotel night we paid for in Albuquerque that we didn’t use. We’ve bought more than 24 airline flights in the last year - not one was on Southwest. We are absolutely disgusted with Southwest and will never fly them again.
Route: New Orleans to Albuquerque via Houston

Reviews: Not Verified |  We attempted to book a flight from BWI to Indianapolis for Sunday, October 16, 2022 and wanted to use miles. We were in the process of putting in the information to purchase the ticket and got a notice that we needed to purchase additional miles. We purchased $345 in additional miles to have enough for the ticket and then continued to enter the rest of our information for the ticket. When we clicked purchase, we got an error message and it said to call the airline. Upon speaking with a Southwest Airlines representative, we were told that the flight was now sold out. So frustrating. We then asked for our money back for the miles we could no longer use and were told that they were non-refundable. Apparently Southwest thinks it's ok to spend $345 and not even get a ticket for it. When I asked to speak with a supervisor, I was told that they would forward my "case" to Corporate Customer Relations and that we'd hear from them in 10-12 business days. We just received a call from a Customer Relations representative and all he did was explain that he wouldn't refund the money and that it was their policy. The entire process is a bait and switch and should be banned. Southwest Airlines should stop these fraudulent practices and refund customer's money when they can't give them a ticket. We plan to avoid Southwest Airlines whenever we can. Watch out.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | Southwest has given affordable flights and continues to so, I enjoy traveling with them. My complaint isn’t the flight itself, its about the boarding. I pay extra to fly business class, so that I can board early and get my pick of seats. Over the past year I’ve sat back and watched more and more people pre boarding. It is obvious that 95% of the pre boarders aren’t disabled, they have just learned the system and are abusing it. All passengers see it and recognize the problem but yet, Southwest has done nothing. My wife flies with me through my campaign pass but she never boards in the same group as I board. We apply for our boarding pass at the same time and she ends up 50 people behind me. When will Southwest fix this problem. I’ve voiced both problems to flight attendants and I’m always told that they are aware of the problem and that they get lots of complaints about it. I’m rating this 5 out of 10 because I’m always upset when boarding. Ruins a portion of the flight every time.

Reviews:
✅ Trip Verified |  
This is the worst airline service in The United States by long stretch. This airline has managed to make what should be simple, into a complicated mess with their seating program. If you have to be somewhere on time or if you have to be at an event that is time dependent, do not fly this airline. You will be late and there will be multiple delays or delays then a cancellation following right after. This airline doesn’t cancel early ever, if they cancel a flight, it’s last minute when they calculate it isn’t worth a flight. They do not care if you depended on them, this airline will bend you over with no remorse or second thoughts. This is the airline that will get you to places, but that could mean between 1-3 days after your scheduled flight because of delays and cancellations at the last minute due to not selling enough tickets, but this is how this business conducts its service. Soon enough they’ll be going out of business, and I can’t wait to see this lousy airline become a part of airline bankruptcy history. I will never fly this airline again. I would rather drive or walk to my destination. I am not impressed by this airlines performance. Their service has dropped below its competitors.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego: Jam packed terminal, absolutely no seating for the entire day. I stood for hours. Multiple delays and two flight re-bookings from 10:55 AM until 6:10 PM in San Diego, when I finally boarded the last flight out of San Diego to Chicago trying to get to Washington DC. I was assured by the gate agent that I would make my connection from Chicago to DC. I missed it by 30 minutes. Arrived at MDW in the middle of the night. No open restaurants in the airport. Took shuttle to expensive hotel, not in my budget, to say the least. No room service. Closed for the night.  No meal vouchers, no compensation offered. Spent $175 for a 5 hour stay. Southwest claimed weather related issues, but other airlines were taking off from San Diego in the fog! Why not Southwest? The truth is, I overheard personnel (flight attendants, gate agents) discussing missing co-workers.  Saying that the delays were weather related let them off the hook for any compensations to abandoned passengers. Flight four of four: Jam packed terminal in Houston, waiting for flight to San Diego. Screaming 3 yr old, screaming 1 year old (same family) in terminal, waiting for our flight. The family (three women) held these screaming children on their laps in the terminal for an hour, never letting them down to walk or run. Then, on the airplane, they sat in the seats behind me. I was in the bulkhead seat, along-side a handicapped man. For the duration of the three hour flight, the young, inexperienced mother did nothing to quiet her children while she read a book.. She gave them no toys, did not talk to them, just let them kick the seats in front of them non-stop, squirt juice onto the head of the handicapped man, all the while letting out non-stop ear-piercing, blood-curdling screams. I have travelled with toddlers before, many times. I know it can be difficult, but this was a parenting issue. The flight attendant was just a few feet away, so could not miss what was going on. The handicapped man asked the flight attendant to intervene multiple times. Only twice, she spoke gently to the mother, who responded "They are children! What am I supposed to do?" She was completely unapologetic. The flight attendant never spoke in a firm manner with her, as she should have. I can't help but think that if the screaming kicking person were an adult, the plane would have been landed at the nearest airport and an arrest would have occurred with head -spinning speed. Why is such torture of other passengers tolerated? There was a lot that could have been done to alleviate the situation. Do children's rights trump adult's rights? One of those screaming children did not even pay for a seat, as we adults did. My seat-mate and I agreed that, even though we have both been die-hard Southwest customers for decades (I am 68, and I have been flying on you since you were a baby airline!), we said to each other that we would never again willingly fly Southwest. It has become a cattle-car with none of the humor or comeraderie that used to make it bearable to fly in seats intended to fit middle-schoolers. Bye Southwest.
Route: Washington to San Diego via Houston

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Santa Ana to Portland via San Jose. Our group of 3 persons paid the add on fee of Early Bird for our round trip. Our trip down went as booked. However, Sept 30 we did our online check in (22 hours ahead) and had been assigned A24-25-26 early bird boarding for both legs of our returning flights. Yesterday— Oct 1, 2022 we got to the airport to check in only to find out we had been reassigned to C group on first leg and B group on 2nd leg. At this point we still had NO IDEA our entire itinerary had been changed. I paid an additional $30 fee to upgrade to A7 boarding the other 2 in my group kept their C group. We were all confused and angry. We got down to the gate only to realize we were not even on flight 376 anymore but we were now on a flight 282 to San Jose and our SJC to PDX was also different. So we were no longer on our 4:10pm flight out of Santa Ana to San Jose. We had been moved to a 6:45pm flight because we found out our Portland connection flight had been cancelled. So because they had changed our itinerary at 9am on 10/1 we no longer had A group early bird boarding assigned. We were now stuck in C boarding which was why I had been told I had to pay another $30 upgrade fee so that I would still be in A group. The agent checking us in never even realized what had happened to us. She was very nice but her explanations to us were NOT accurate. She never even told us we were no longer on our 4:10 pm flight. As far as I’m concerned —ALL of this was horrible SW airlines service. We were never consulted on any changes or choices that were made for us. When we did our initial online check in we were in A group for our original reservation flights. When they changed us they did not give us our PrePaid early bird check ins for those new flights. In addition, in reality they should never have changed our first flight either because we could have just had an extended layover of 2 hours in San Jose but still had our pre assigned A group for that portion. I am unhappy and VERY dissatisfied. If they are moving flights they need to be sure they can still honor their own early bird boarding on the flights they are moving their customers to. I am giving them a very low rating because they did not honor the early bird options that our group of 3 had chosen when we made our original reservations and also PAID for. In addition I’m giving the ticket agent a 3 rating because while she was a very nice woman — she should have been able to figure out and tell us that all these changes had been made!! Instead I just paid another $30 for something I had already paid additional for — early check in and A group boarding.
Route: Santa Ana to Portland via San Jose

Reviews: Not Verified |  I have flown Southwest since 1980. Their on time performance is now the laughing stock of the industry. Today my outbound flight is delayed 2 hours. I have always been loyal to them, I have kept flying them with hope that they will fix the delays. However, I am now switching to Delta on my next trip. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  My friend and I were seated a few feet away from the boarding gate since the gate was overcrowded. We were constantly paying attention to any boarding announcements or boarding status displays on the LCD. Other than a 10 min departure delay, there was no other display shown nor any announcements made. When we were close to the departure time, I reached out to the desk to inquire when the boarding would begin. Thats when the LCD showed 'boarding closed' status. There was no personnel at the desk to answer our questions, no boarding announcement made nor any paging calls placed! when we reached our adjacent gate, the associate told us the plane had boarded and was getting ready for departure and that we had missed our flight. All this when we were seated just next to the gate. I had to shell out $450 for another airline ticket to reach my final destination. I have traveled extensively for the past 15 years and have never missed a flight. In this day and age of texts, emails, paging boarding calls, displays and announcements there isn't any opportunity for missing a flight unless the airline doesn't have proper protocol in place to page checked in passengers for boarding. Southwest refused to admit it was their fault. I even showed them a pic of the gate a few min before departure, wondering what's going on with boarding. Both my friend and I could not have missed the boarding call had it been made in the first place. I am not flying Southwest again.

There was a WWII veteran on the plane with us as well that the crew members and the pilot recognized overhead where all other passengers gave a round applause. Yet again, all passengers once again clapped and thanked the veteran. It was one of the best, If not the best experiences I have had on any airline. Thank you Southwest for doing this!

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | I bought a round trip ticket on Southwest. I was told that bringing my golf clubs in a case would not be a problem. I arrived in Greenville, but my luggage didn't. I had to fill out paperwork and instructions, then go to my destination without any of my needed possessions, including medications. My bags finally arrived and the following day I unpacked my golf carrier, only to discover that Southwest had broken the shaft on my $500 driver. I had to borrow a driver to play the round and cancel other rounds because I couldn't use the same one. I reported the broken driver to Southwest only to be told that they didn't cover the clubs or bag for any loss. I went back and looked at the baggage section on the website and there was no mention of that in the basic policies. Only when digging much deeper was there any information regarding that kind of loss. So in addition to being treated like cattle, squeezed into tiny seats with no legroom, forced to endure 3 plane changes and 4 layovers, I'm out $500 for my favorite driver. I will never use this unprofessional subpar airline again.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Las Vegas to Long Beach. Southwest Airlines employees used to be so friendly and helpful. I guess those days are gone. I was willing to put up with the cattle call seating, delays, and stale pretzels because the treatment was pretty great. The last flight I took began in Long Beach and ended in Las Vegas. I needed additional assistance getting my ticket changed and stood in line for over an hour. Some "diva" manager was leaving and left the passengers in the hands of an elderly woman who was clearly new on the job. The diva offered no assistance but flitted in and out of the ticket area while the newbie floundered. Yesterday, I checked on two flights and saw that the return flights on both were not there. In a panic, I quickly made the additional flights. In reviewing my credit card, I saw that I had actually made the round-trip flights. So, I called "customer service. The CSR who was supposed to be helpful was rude and clearly did not want to take my call. She huffed and tapped her pen and kept saying okay, okay I got it even when I was talking. Then, she proceeded to put in the flights but I still was overcharged. I saw online that my original flights (2) had been canceled and she told me that when a passenger gets new flights their previous ones are canceled.

Reviews: Not Verified |  I would never fly Southwest again. I understand delays happen, but I am very confident that flights are being cancelled because they are not full enough. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Southwest lost my bag. I am not upset they lost my bag - as stuff happens. I am upset with the follow up and follow thru of Southwest staff to return my bag to me. And how the Southwest agent misinformed me on the policy for purchases and reimbursement. Your agent told me “get whatever you need and we will be able to cut a check for you for pickup, after receipts are provided.” Yep - that is not the Southwest protocol. I asked manager at the DesMoines terminal to train and educate her staff so other passengers aren’t misinformed down the line. She did not respond. We traveled to Iowa for a wedding, my bag had my clothes as well as clothes for my 2 year old daughters (who was a flower girl in the wedding). Upon arrival with no bag, the nice gal at the Southwest counter said it will be here late tonight, and to call before coming in case the flight was delayed. I called at 4am the following morning (as that’s when she said was the next opening of the office) and my bag hadn’t moved from my original departure location. I called 4 more times that day, to be told different stories each time about how they would get my back to DesMoines, or that is was just sitting and they couldn’t tell what was going on until the bag was scanned in again. It almost seemed like once the bag is lost, there isn’t really a person who ensures it gets back on a flight to the final destination. The agents could only tell me where it was sitting. No bag delivered Saturday night. Bag finally delivered Sunday morning. Upon arrival, the nice gal at the counter gave me my bag and told my to come by after 1pm and they will have a check ready. She even scanned in my receipts. Came by after 1pm and she explained to me that I had to email the Southwest Manager at the DesMoines airport for details on how to submit the claim.  I just spend the better part of $800 and now you explain to me that I have to submit a claim and wait 30-45 days. I would not be upset if she informed me of the correct process on the front end. All I ask for is better training. Southwest - you can do it!

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  My grandson and I were supposed to leave Juan Santamaria Airport in San Jose, Costa Rica en route to Baltimore at 1:05 p.m. on Saturday, August 13. The flight had six delays and did not depart until after 7:00 p.m. The passengers were told that the scheduled pilot had flown too many hours within some specified time, and was over FAA regulations. Another pilot needed to be found. In addition, they said there were "some problems in Baltimore" without specifying what. I will note there are a lot of problems in Baltimore. It seems completely irresponsible to me that an airline would not keep track of pilot hours flown in order to avoid putting their customer through the situation we experienced. Before we boarded we were informed that our flight would not be non-stop, which is what we paid for. The reason given was that be the time we reached Baltimore the customs agents would have quit work for the day. We were rerouted through Houston, which added another two hours to our total flying time. When we arrived in Houston we had to drag our carry-ons out of the plane at 11:00 p.m. to have them clear customs--over three hours after we were to have landed in Baltimore--then lug them back onto the plane. Our flight finally touched down in Baltimore around 4:00 a.m., over eight hours later than the scheduled 7:45 p.m. arrival of the previous day. At least my grandson and I could go home. Many travelers were transferring in Baltimore to other destinations. For them, the agony of the day only continued. I will add that our check-in to go to Costa Rica on Saturday, August 6 did not go well either. The line at the international check-in was over one-eighth of a mile long! I have photos to prove it. Southwest did not have sufficient agents to accommodate the customers on the international flights they had booked. They were grossly understaffed. It was only through the intercession of an agent that my grandson and I were able to make our departing flight. Southwest offered the passengers on our returning flight a $200 coupon good for another Southwest flight within the next year. Big deal! We paid $1,000 round trip, $500 each way. If they really wanted to make amends they would have had a rebate commensurate with the frustration they heaped upon their customers. When Southwest arrived on the national scene years ago as a regional airline which was expanding I was very impressed. They can blame their current problems encountered by me, my grandson, and all the other customers on COVID, not enough employees, supply-chain issues, or whatever other excuses are in vogue these days. It is clear to me that this company has devolved to a significant degree. They have lost the customer-orientation they once had. Not being able to add the hours a pilot flies, and not being able to compute how many check-in people are needed for the departing flights are issues of poor management. Very poor! I will be looking for other carriers for my future trips to Costa Rica, and suggest to all who read this not to fly Southwest until such time that they give evidence of better management ... like being able to add and divide.
Route: Juan Santamaria to Baltimore-Washington via Houston

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  My brother and I were flying into Denver (round trip) and were going to take a second flight into Colorado Springs. We were supposed to meet up with our two sisters who were also taking flights into Denver, but not the Springs. When we were getting ready to board our flight to the Springs, we realized it was more efficient to meet up with our sisters at the Denver airport, so we went up to customer service to explain what we wanted to do. The lady at the desk told us that if we didn’t take our flight to Colorado Springs, we would forfeit our return flight. so we said “oh never mind, we will take our flight to Colorado Springs, we don’t want to forfeit the return flight.” but the lady insisted she would help us and cancel the in between flight, and assured us that we would be able to return home. no problem. now, we came to the Springs for our return flight and my itinerary did not come up, while so my brother was able to check in no problem. the lady at the front desk told me that i had forfeited my flight when i came into Denver, even though the woman who we talked to in Denver about it said she was taking care of us. I had to purchase my ticket again for the return flight while my brother had no problem with his return flight.
Route: Denver to Colorado Springs via Baltimore

Reviews: Not Verified |  I appreciate almost everything about Southwest Airlines: their friendly staff members, their free check bags, and even their customer service agents. But what really brings my review in today is a frustration that really ruined the experience altogether. After an anticipated flight home they texted to report that they had canceled our flight, with very short notice. They then rebooked us for another flight with 7+ hrs of airtime. Traveling with an infant makes that possibility near disaster. When I tried to call and rebook (the customer service gal was very courteous, but there wasn’t much she could do) every other flight was significantly longer in airtime or wasn’t until weeks out (since all the more direct flights had been sold out probably months ago). I would like Southwest to consider how this effects the people of whom they claim to care for. The short notice on cancelation left us no choice but to bite the bullet and pay a more expensive ticket on another airline (since its booking a day before) or waste time that could have been spent with the family we were hoping to see and take the longer more miserable travel route. I’m not sure on the reason for the cancelation but a promise/commitment to provide a service should mean something, especially when you pay for it! It would be nice if they would follow through. Regardless of the fact that they may lose a little money by flying a plane that doesn’t get sold out. If the cancelation was for other reasons not related to business or money, I may understand. If that is the case this review can be disregarded.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | We arrived at 9.15am for a flight that was to be boarding at 10. When we arrived the flight was delayed to 10.50am due to unknown reason. Southwest also makes you board in assigned numbers, but doesn’t give you assigned seats so every man/woman for themselves. When we had finally boarded the plane we began again to wait while the 3 flight attendants made jokes and conversed when they should’ve been making sure we are ready for take-off. After that we waited again as they delayed the flight for weather purposes. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  The second leg of my daughter's return flight to MSP was cancelled. SW could only offer a replacement flight the next day. She would have to spend a night in Baltimore rather than flying on to Minneapolis as scheduled. The SW agent directed her to work it out with another airline, but a Delta supervisor explained that Southwest doesn't participate in a reciprocal arrangement with any other airline. My daughter was forced to buy a Delta ticket at double the cost of the original Southwest flight in order to get home the same day. I meanwhile ran back to the SW counter to get a refund. Supposedly SW will refund the cost of the cancelled flight (half the replacement cost) but I haven’t seen that yet. Desired outcome (optional) For all the inconvenience, stress, and extra cost, SW, at minimum, needs to make reimbursement of the full cost of the replacement flight

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Our flight was delayed about 3 hours and we didn’t leave Orlando until after 1am… not the end of the world but there were no representatives giving us any updates on the status of our flight but just a gate monitor showing our flight getting more and more delayed which was kind of frustrating. It would have been nice to see better communication from Southwest employees so I knew why the plane was delayed and if I should expect it to be cancelled or not. At one point during my long wait at the gate, they started boarding another flight that wasn’t supposed to leave until 2 hours after ours so that was frustrating as well. I just felt like my flight was forgotten about until 1am. On the bright side, I got into the A boarding group without paying extra for reserved check-in despite it being a full flight. The crew was very nice, the seats were fairly comfortable, and I got a variety of free snacks as well as a free drink. Entertainment was available on the Southwest app and WiFi was available for purchase. If it weren’t for the lack of communication and delay, I would give Southwest 10/10. I would recommend them as long as you book a flight that isn’t at night because it will most likely get delayed due to summer thunderstorms or staffing shortages and you may not get home until the following day.

Reviews: Not Verified | Atlanta to La Guardia. On Monday, July 25th, 2022, my daughter and I were returning home from Atlanta to NYC (LaGuardia) via Southwest Airlines. First time ever using them. We arrive at the airport at 4AM for a 6:10AM flight. After going through TSA and sitting at the gate for a while, our flight was cancelled with no announcement or warning. My daughter happened to look up and see on the gate TV screen the words “CANCELLED”. The gate personnel were gone and I was left to 1) calm my daughter’s nerves because she has never experienced this before 2) calm my own nerves as I suffered from severe anxiety and my meds were in my checked bag and 3) try to figure out what to do next. Keep in mind, I booked the early morning flight because I had to be home by 9:30am to take over the babysitting duties of my two other children so that my wife could go to work. So that was my first thing to address, finding last minute child care. I then get an email confirming that my flight was indeed cancelled (no explanation as to why) and I was put on the 8:25 PM plane to LGA later that night. So now the next steps were to find out what happened to our checked bags and what to do for 14 hours till my flight with pretty much no money left for my daughter and I to find a hotel (I mean we’re taking a low budget airline. I’m a stay-at-home dad living on my wife’s income. Go figure). 14 hours later with our bags in NY before we are even on a plane, we get to the departing gate for our rescheduled 8:25pm flight and of course it’s DELAYED. 9:10pm is the new departure time. Then it’s pushed back to 10PM!!! Once on the plane, only water and a snack was offered to us (soda, coffee and alcohol were no longer an option). Once at LaGuardia, we then had to find our checked bags. My pre-arranged airport pick-up, no longer available. The line for a taxi, extremely long. My daughter and I jumped on a city bus to take us to Manhattan so that we could take a taxi to the Bronx. $30 dollars I couldn’t afford to spend charged to my credit card. Long story short, got to the airport at 4AM and after an anxiety inducing day/afternoon, my daughter and I get home at 2am in the morning. Fast forward to today. I call Southwest customer service to 1) get an explanation and 2) find out how Southwest can make things right for me so that I can continue using them in the future (again, this was my first ever experience with them). The agent informed me that the first flight was canceled due to weather and that the rescheduled flight was delayed due to air traffic control issues, so we were not entitled to compensation. 1) I never once said on the call I wanted to be compensated so that was quite an assumption and 2) was then told after reiterating everything I went through “would you have preferred that we put you on an unsafe flight?” I mean WOW!!!!! What a “great” condescending customer service response. To the Southwest rep that hopefully reads this (and yes, I will be posting this on MULTIPLE review sites and social media), I shall NEVER fly Southwest again and will voice my displeasure to anyone who asks me about my experience with Southwest. PS- My family and I had an issue with JetBlue a few years ago and their customer service was the TOTAL OPPOSITE of what I experienced with Southwest. Very warm, helpful and their actions showed that I was a valued customer.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Orlando. I booked a flight for my family of 9 to depart on June 29 at 9am and when we get to the airport awaiting to be boarded, they announced the flight is canceled at 8:30am. A few minutes later, they arranged the passengers to either call or wait in line to the customer counter to have flight rearrange. The reason that was given the flight was cancelled is that weather in Orlando is bad enough for they now allowing flights to come in (which is a super stupid and big lie). And it was just that I searched the internet to see that over 1000 of their pilots are picketing and I believe this is the true reason and they just not willing to admit that and unwilling to cut low on their flights to accommodate this. Instead, my flight is delayed for almost 12 hrs and my family of 9 had to split up with 3 flying to transfer in Ohio. We ended up to arrive in Orlando at 1 in the morning instead of 1 in the afternoon. And I see that a flight on the same day departing at 10 am did not have a delay or cancellation. This is the first time I fly in Southwest and probably the last time. I accept delay but I do not accept giving unbelievable excuses due to the company’s poor management and their attitude to just want to make money and carelessness for people whatsoever.

Reviews: Not Verified |  Southwest post COVID is a complete disappointment. They were known for customer service and were the last to come to the party with positive customer service and drink service after the pandemic. It is clear that morale among flight attendants is low - not sure if that is due to corporate support or employee entitlement after COVID. I have switched to Delta and United for all business travel and now fly SW only for price necessity. I was a very loyal customer for years and now feel no loyalty at all. Prices are not worth it. Late flights, SW waits too long for delayed passengers - how does it make sense to hold up 200 (ish) passengers for 5 people? I have been on both sides and would have understood if flight had to leave. Today we waited 45 minutes for 5 passengers, all of whom boarded in the first 30 minutes. Why the extra 15 min? Previously delightful attendants now act put out and entitled. Prices aren’t as competitive as they were historically. What a shame - used to be such a great company.

Reviews: Not Verified |  Unfortunately, a friend was not able to make a flight that I had purchased for them. Since I was in the middle of a flight myself, I could not cancel the flight. Southwest enacted their no show policy. Therefore, no refund could be given for the initial missed fight nor the return trip. The overall cost was +$600. I can understand penalizing me for the initial flight, but to take the funds for the return flight is downright criminal. I was given a travel voucher for only $150. I have noticed that in the past few months that the customer service at Southwest has dramatically declined. I have tried to contact them several times concerning this issue. I only receive a generic reply email stating the no-show policy and a half-hearted sorry. I would say that if you plan flying with them to at least check other options.
Route: Harlingen to Saint Louis via Houston

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  I’m currently sitting in the Houston Hobby airport fighting back tears of anger and frustration. Southwest should be ashamed of themselves but they are not. We landed from Harlingen at 9:04pm getting alerts that our flight home to St. Louis was delayed the minute airplane mode went off. Currently our flight home is a play pretend flight; as of this very moment the departure is scheduled for 2:19am and originally that departure was 9:55pm. We have no real scheduled flight home because the departure time is constantly being moved, the excuse is MCO weather bc that is the connecting flight however the gate next to ours is on time and flying into MCO, Southwest has no responsibility in the matter or to make anything right bc it’s “the weather’s fault”? I’m so disappointed. I exclusively fly Southwest. Say nice things (until now). Encourage and book trips that make y’all a lot of money. Even had one booked for 2 weeks from now that thanks to your lack of accountability I have plenty of time to cancel sitting in your airport waiting for my play pretend flight. The icing on the cake? Myself and my travel partner were offered a flight out in the morning if we chose to pay for our own accommodations due to the lack of accountability or give a damn by Southwest.  Get your life together Southwest, you just lost a life long traveler on your airline but based on how you do things you obviously don’t care in the least.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | I am tall to the point where I need special accommodation for seats, because of this I was a little worried when my family bought seats with Southwest, as they don't have a business class. Fortunately (I thought) a nice lady at the gate upgraded me to pre board. I had bought early boarding before and I thought this was an upgrade. Unfortunately the front row seats had gotten taken by the elderly and children, so I went back to exit row seats. With pre board you are not allowed to sit in the exit row though. While I appreciate the gate lady that "upgraded" me the flight attendants were rude about it and people that should have boarded after me anyways got the seats with enough leg room while my knees got embossed with the arm rests of the seats in front of me. I have canceled my return tickets and am spending hundreds of extra dollars to never fly with Southwest again.

Reviews: Not Verified |  In November of 2021, I flew Southwest Airlines to visit my family in Oklahoma City. Purchased EarlyBird check-in and had an A46 boarding position. We had a layover in Phoenix after flying in from San Diego, and our flight to OKC got delayed by about 2 hours, with our original 7 PM departure time being delayed to 9 PM. Talked to the gate agent and she said the delay was caused by our aircraft being delayed in Baltimore. Our aircraft had SWA's older Evolve cabin. I got about an hour of sleep before arriving in OKC. On the return trip, we flew to Denver where our plane had the newer Heart interior. The plane to San Diego had the Evolve cabin again. There was no delay, and we ended up getting back home to San Diego safely. Honestly, I like Southwest for their low fares and open seating.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  What a scam airline. Everyone should know this scam they are pulling while bragging about no bag fees. This is there only selling point. They know they would lose 50% of their customers overnight if they started bag fees. There check in procedure is set up to make you want to use your points to upgrade. I was waiting to check in with my laptop and phone through there own app. Conveniently enough, when 24 hour check time came up, the website and app took 3 minutes to come up with the check in button. By the time it did and I was able to hit check in, I was given end of B group. I immediately called southwest to find out what was wrong with there system. The lady said nothing was wrong, BUT, we can upgrade you for 25,000 points to put you in A 1-15. I jumped on it because I want to use my points up and will never fly southwest again. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | Sarasota to Denver. Flew on 061922 with two children from Denver to Sarasota, with a layover in Indianapolis. Flew back on the 25th with a layover in Dallas. On the way there I got a text message from Southwest that my flight had been delayed by hours. Luckily I was in the airport when I got the message and could determine the flight had been delayed, but by less than an hour. Gate attendants were unable to explain the reason for the incorrect message. Flying back, I got another text before leaving for the airport that the flight was delayed by hours. I checked the website and found this was another incorrect message from Southwest and the delay was again less than an hour. I found other customer reviews indicating many others had received similar text messages from Southwest and the inconvenience and expense for some had been significant. There were enough reviews that Southwest had to be aware of the problem for some time and had not fixed it. I’ll be doing everything I can to avoid flying Southwest in the future.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Currently ongoing. Typically have recommended this airline, but this has been a horrible experience. Our flight from STL to Portland, ME had our connecting flight in Baltimore canceled. Customer service was horrid and had to eat money on 2 hotel rooms for that night; the impromptu one and the originally scheduled one. Lost a full 24 hours waiting on the flight we got rebooked for. On the rebooked flight, we paid extra for A-boarding, but due to their system issue or something their personnel forgot to do in the computer with pur luggage, we got kicked out of line and had to go to customer service; nothing about us getting refunded that money. Now, flying back from Portland via Chicago to STL, showed up to airport and flight immediately delayed 2 hours. As plane touched down and getting ready to board, announced another 45 minute delay due to "weather." Checked weather in Chicago: beautiful. Weather here: beautiful. Weather in-between: nothing. It's all staff, but they're walking all over their customers using Weather as an excuse to keep from compensating anyone.
Route: Albany NY to Chicago (Midway) via Oklahoma City OK

Reviews: Not Verified |  As my departure time neared, I received several messages over the course of 2 hours. Each indicating an additional delay. This now meant I had no hope of making my connecting flight. I called to reschedule for the next possible flights to my destination. After waiting a half hour on hold, I explained my situation to a human, and was asked to be put on hold while he found me another flight. As I had already looked up possible flight schedules, I thought this would be a quick hold, as there were very few possibilities. After 40 minutes on hold, I was hung up on. Now, I have to call back. This time it only took 15 minutes to get a human, so I should consider myself lucky, right? I explained everything over again, and apologized if I sounded irate (which I was). This time, I just told the woman which flight I wanted. I then inquired about what she could do to make me feel better about flying Southwest, ever again in the future. I suggested a simple upgrade to 'A' on my boarding pass, to get me on the plane earlier, so I might get a window seat. This would have cost the airline nothing, and would have made me feel like they were actually sorry about my being quite inconvenienced. She said she couldn't do that, but could give me a discount on my next flight (which would cost them). I told her I didn't want a coupon for a flight I might never take, and she asked if I'd like to speak to someone about it. I said that I would like to speak with a supervisor, and was about to insist on not being put on hold, when...I was put on hold. I'm not one to give up easily, so I waited on hold... for an hour and a half, before I was forced to hang up because I had to leave home for my new flight at 3am, and it was almost 11pm. Now I'm going to be late for an appointment at my destination and get only 4 hours of sleep. I have great respect for Southwest flight personnel, but their customer service absolutely awful! And, I'm unlikely to fly with them again, because of that.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Southwest Airlines is a nightmare. I have never encountered airline staff so horrific in my lifetime. When we arrived at our gate to board 10 minutes early, they yelled at us to haul our butts on board and that we were “late”. Except they failed to tell us that our actual flight was at another gate, instead, all 3 staff members yelled that we were on a different flight and how dare we try to board this one…except this was the gate and time our tickets stated. They refused to even look at our tickets to find out which gate they moved our flight to. After 10 minutes of sitting feeling confused, I went back up to them and asked where we were supposed to board our flight that our tickets said was boarding at that time and that exact gate we were waiting at. The guy sheepishly realized that they just about caused us to miss our flight which had been moved 10 gates down…instead of letting us know right away, they shamed us for following the information on our tickets and demanded we get out of their faces. Unbelievable.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Southwest Airlines took $3,650.76 on May 27,2022 and refused to refund my money for a flight that they had cancel due to inclement weather on that date. Southwest had dispense my older children luggage to 2 different states which was Houston, Texas and my twins stroller Denver, Colorado and my medications went to Houston, Texas as well. Southwest took a total of $7,500 in less than 48 hours and my family never flew in the airplane. Southwest took $7,500, ship our luggage to 2 different states, cancelling our flight without proper notice and called the Sherriff department to follow my family around the terminal to give us a ticket that we currently have to see a judge about now to clear our name. On top of paying $7,650.76, Southwest ask me to pay more money for my twins when I had originally paid for them to board the plane. Southwest never gave my family an apology for all of the strife, chaos, shaming, belittlement that’s that my have put on my family.  I will never have my family to board Southwest ever again. I have lost all respect for this airline company. I have encountered some rude and unprofessional workers on the customer-service lines who talks fast pace to get you off the line. Southwest promise my family a flight on 5/28/2022 blast 5:50am, they let my family board the plane as a touring experience, sit down on plane, then ask all of us to exit the plane. My personal preference will be to never paid or even board this airline again. If you want to get rip off, taking advantage of, swindle out of your hard earn money than choose this airplane as your 1st choice. Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  So after 3 years, I decided to fly on SW airlines again. I've always had an amazing experience with this airline. They delayed my flight 10 minutes before boarding for 3 hrs. (It said on time even when the plane landed and was at the gate). They said it was the air traffic control in MCO. I checked the flight delays on all airlines. There were only 2 (that were non SWA, SWA had tons). Even frontier and spirit had none. AA was flying nonstop with no cancelations.  I then was cancelled and put on standby. I stood at the airport all night until all planes were exhausted (along with other families that had been there way longer than I had). I never got on a plane. In the mean time, I booked a ticket on AA. I asked for a hotel/motel voucher (they laughed). So I took a ride to DFW from Dallas love with a trip booked in the morning. I had to pay for the motel room. I never cancelled my flight. My thought was maybe I'm wrong. The data is lying to me. Yet, I was right. I got on that flight with AA with no problem. I monitored my standby/alternate ticket situation with SW the entire time in air and off. It kept getting pushed back over and over again. To the point that it was landing 3 days from the point I booked. I canceled. I'd love to give my credit to someone needing a flight, but I cannot. I'm the only one it works for.  Never again will I book this airline! They are worse than Spirit or Frontier. BTW, My AA ticket coming back was not delayed or canceled either. I'm sure some have had problems with AA and many other airlines. But, I haven't.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  I’ve historically loved Southwest. The two free bags, open seating, reliable flights and communication were excellent. But now this airline is nothing short of a vile, greedy company. In the past year, more than half of my flights have been significantly delayed or outright cancelled. Any getaway comes with an asterisk - best not to make any plans at the destination and save yourself the disappointment. Short notice and some excuse that always dodges responsibility has saddles the customer alone with huge last minute re-booking or hotel fees. To be fair, they always compensate you with a $100 LUV Voucher, which you can put toward the cost of your next Southwest flight, when you’ll inevitably get to repeat this whole process again you masochist. At least there are stale bags of pretzel crumbs to keep you satisfied as you sit and wait a few hours for that last-second cancellation.

Reviews: Not Verified |  You really take a chance getting to Nashville Airport especially with the crazy traffic. I was flying out of Nashville on Southwest Airline. I live 2 hours away. You could at any time be in a traffic jam for 2 hours. I was lucky arrived 4 1/2 hours early. So I stood in line for 1/2 hour to check in. Oh no, you can't check in. You are too early. Apparently you can't check in with Southwest Airlines more than 3 hours early. Who knew. So I went and sat for another hour and watched people. Very interesting. It's better than being late. Boarding the plane, my seating pass was in the B section. I usually go toward the rear but every seat I wanted was being saved by the passenger next to it. So I had to actually turn around along with other passengers behind me so I could find a seat. Did not know that you are allowed to save seats on Southwest. The stewardess just shrugged her shoulders and asked people to back up. What a mess. What is the point of paying an extra $15 to get to board early.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  As the pilot is doing his safety briefing over the intercom (which they have to mandatorily do before takeoff), the Flight Attendant is going through the motions very sarcastically and making funny faces as the pilot is explaining the expectations, roles, and responsibilities of the personnel on the plane if it was to crash.  I then hear the FA  getting upset about someone's luggage "poking out in the way". He wasn't very calm about the situation and was on edge.  The messages from the Pilot and the head Flight Attendant kept coming, and I kept listening. I had my Earpods in but paused my music every time a message would come over the intercom. Even with my music paused, I could not understand what was being said over the intercom. I asked the FA  about what beverages they had. He looked at me like I was speaking another language and made drastic body motions pointing at his ears. I knew what he meant but was still shocked that this flight attendant was having such a horrible attitude towards everyone on the plane.
Route: Tampa to Buffalo via Midway Chicago

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified |  Deplorable customer service! They deserve a negative star. I flew from Syracuse to Charlotte 4/24 when I get my stroller bag I noticed it was partially unzipped, when I go to get the stroller out I see both wheels are broken off and placed under the stroller. The top bassinet/carrier part was also disconnected, which was connected when I checked it in and zipped it up. I know my stroller was intentionally dismantled to make it fit smoother under the plane. I went to the ticket counter where Diane and a manager both told me they do not cover damages only losses. They filled out a report and said I can try to talk to customer service to see if they will replace it. I was sent home with no replacement and no check to replace my infant's stroller. Quickly forward to 5/1, I flew from St. Louis back to Charlotte again, only to have my car seat that I checked in not put on the plane! Once again Diane was at the ticket counter and gave me a loaner car seat. However, my car seat was also in a travel bag that needed to be replaced. Diane brought out the replacement car seat in a travel bag, but refused to loan it to me. I asked to speak to the manager and advised her when Southwest delivers my car seat and travel bag I will give them both (car seat and car seat bag) of theirs back. We stood there for about 30 minutes going back and forth. 20 minutes in she ask me to verify my name as if I had just walked up like Diane didn't already do it. Diane had already got my ticket and verified who I was (which is how I got the loaner car set from the beginning of the ordeal). Security was called, the manager said she couldn't believe I was acting like this and refused to give me the name of her regional manager. When I asked for her to write down her supervisor's name she refused and said you can take it down yourself. She started talking through her teeth at me like I was a child and threatened to walk away if I recorded her. If your acting professionally you wouldn't care if someone recorded you. Everyone after the gate and above the ground were great. Southwest train your ticket counter employees and ramp agents to treat people and their property with respect.

Reviews: Not Verified |  This is about customer service. We created a credit card with Southwest last year. They had two sets of nonstop flights to Virginia, which made it easy to travel to see my parents, which was important because we have two small children. A 5-hour flight with a layover has turned into a 12-hour flight due to delays, which isn't easy with small children. Imagine an unplanned 5 hours in the Dulles Airport. Well, these flights were in place throughout COVID, and were full, always. As soon as COVID started to lift, these flights disappeared. Gone. Now, we have at least one stop and more frequently, 2 stops to get to our destination. The same is true for my husband's family in New York. Southwest used to fly direct, and they dropped the direct flights. Today, I was on the phone trying to apply travel vouchers. I was under the impression that I needed to book travel within the expiration timeframe, not complete travel within the expiration timeframe. I have work travel that happens less than a week after the expiration date, and together with this misunderstanding, I thought maybe Southwest would help me out. No such luck; told me it's my problem. Obviously, it is my problem, but I hoped that an airline whose hold message (which I listened to for 20 minutes while my customer service agent took other calls instead of helping me) repeatedly talks about how much they care about customers, might have some flexibility in such a short timeframe. Other businesses help people out to maintain positive customer relations; too bad Southwest has turned a corner and is no longer actually serving the customer. That's why I was loyal to them in the first place. No longer.

Reviews: Not Verified |  Normally love SW. My 4:05 pm flight on 4/14/22 had the absolute worst flight attendant crew I have ever had on any  airline and we have been flying regularly (monthly) for more than 30 years. They were rude to many passengers including my husband and I over trivial things that normally aren’t a big deal. An under-seat item being slightly close to the passengers feet not 100% under and I mean slightly as in barely even noticeable, face mask covering nostrils but not up to bridge of nose, giving a family with a screaming child a hard time during landing, husband lowered mask to tell me something bc I couldn’t hear him and she went off on him, etc. The entire three hour flight with this crew was ridiculously awful. They were not pleasant when coming around for drinks or trash. They acted like they had a chip on their shoulder about something. Normally SW attendants have great personalities and offer decent humor on the flight but you got none of that with this gang. The only time they were nice was when announcing their “we know you have a lot of choices and we thank you for choosing SW” spiel at the end of the flight. If I hadn’t had so many great experiences with SW, I wouldn’t book again. I hope this was an isolated incident bc this crew was lousy and rude. I’m refusing to offer anything but a single star in all categories as I was so upset with this crew but I had no issues with the ground service. The seats are not any more or less comfortable than any other larger airline and the food and beverages  are comparable as well. The inflight wifi was not working on any of my SW domestic flights this week so that was annoying as well.

Hertz cancelled our original reservation charged triple the price for the rental which was a downgrade, charged for overage hours and charged for insurance and prepaid gas full tank (they wont use) which was all declined. I'll talk with both of these incompetent companies the next couple days. If your traveling do your due diligence and fly the best airline at the best time of the week. Last but not least we cancelled one day at the hotel which ended up cancelling the whole stay leaving us to frantically find another hotel away from her team hotel. Looking at the internet and talking with many people today I believe that people should be cautious and think twice about booking flights with Southwest and Rental Cars with Hertz as many people have had similar experiences just not all at the same time/trip. Frustrated but safe. Customer service has taken a real dive since our last election in this country.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | Denver to Chicago. Southwest has completely ruined my trip, i have missed my cousins wedding due to all the delays, cancelations and layovers today. I have had my flight canceled three times today. My original flight was scheduled to go non-stop Denver to Chicago O'Hare at 7am, that was canceled. I was rebooked for a flight leaving Denver at 5am with a layover in Austin, that flight was canceled. I was then rebooked for a flight out over Denver to Dallas that was delayed an hour. My then connecting flight from Dallas to Chicago O'Hare was delayed 5 times before being canceled. I am now booked on a flight to Houston and then to Chicago midway just to get me close to home. Canceled on three times, have been in an airport for 11 hours now, still have two flights to go which are not guaranteed not to be canceled and im not even flying to my home airport where my car is, i will have to pay $100+ for a ride from midway to O'hare and 12 hours after i was supposed to originally land. When i asked for some kind of compensation for my troubles and extra expenses, i was lied to by the supervisor at the gate saying i should’ve been offered vouchers this morning which i wasn’t because i was not at the airport when my first two flights got canceled and then she changed her story to say southwest could not provide compensation because my flights were canceled due to atc when in reality, as reported on the news, southwest as had a company wide system shutdown today which in fact is southwest’s fault and should compensation me for what will be almost 20 hours in an airport and/or plane, a 12 hour delay in my arrival to my destination, my arrival to the incorrect airport and my costs of a taxi from midway to O'hare.

Reviews: Not Verified |  I booked my hotel like I always do through Southwest to get points. I was to earn 10,000 points for my stay via the Southwest concierge. Usually my points hot within 4 days after travel is complete. My flight hit and my car rental hit. I was waiting to book a trip for my wife and I to Austin to celebrate a friends redo of their 50th birthday. Points still have not hit after 3 weeks and now I believe they are taking their time out of spite. Now they are telling me they have to wait for hotel to notify on how many points they need to apply to my account. This is complete rubbish, because it tells you how many points when you book and when you get confirmation email from Southwest. At the time the 10,000 points would have given me a total of 72,000 points and I could have booked a trip for us both for 69,000 points. Now it will cost 120,000 points. I travel about twice a month and it looks like this will increase to probably 3 times per month. Going to American Airlines now. Thanks for nothing Southwest. Hope it was worth it.

Reviews: Not Verified |  Shame on Southwest Airlines. My husband and I and our family have used Southwest for over 20 years. This past March 12 we were supposed to leave Portland Maine at 5:30 in the morning and we received a cancellation for no reason on March 11 at 11 PM in the evening. We could not get through to the site via Internet or phone on how to reschedule a new flight. Since we had reservations for two weeks in Orlando all paid for we needed to get on a flight as soon as possible. So my husband tried and tried and waited on hold for almost an hour before he finally just gave up and decided to book a different flight and the only one we could fly find was from Boston which is a 2 Hour Drive instead of a 15 min drive to Portland. The only flight we could find was for 530 leaving Boston that morning which meant we had to leave Portland Maine by 2 AM. We did not sleep at all that night. On top of that the flight that was connecting was delayed as well. The real kicker is that because we did not follow Southwest Airlines rules for rescheduling a canceled flight we had to pay $700 more to drive two hours longer to get to the airport to actually get on a flight. And the person who answered our phone call later on was like oh well too bad you didn’t do it the way you were supposed to. I just don’t understand how a an airline can cancel the flight out of the blue for no reason and not assist their travelers. and then along the way the attendants were rude and obnoxious and in no way helpful or kind. We are still trying to figure out how we can get refunded our money over something that we did not do we did not cancel the flight Southwest airlines canceled the flight. They should honor the fact that we had booked our flights months ahead of time. And they should do a better job when canceling a flight to assist customers and getting to where they need to be.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | Went to attend 90s Con in Hartford, CT for the weekend beginning 3/11. Outgoing departure was on time, good customer service and unproblematic plane change. But due to the winter weather, SWA cancelled my return flight on Sunday—and they didn’t notify me until an hour before my flight was due to leave (via email). They rebooked my flight for Tuesday and I couldn’t do it. I ended up booking a last minute flight on Delta—that got delayed as well — so I ended up staying an extra day. I wish these big airlines had contingency plans for getting customers home. Had SWA rebooked me for Monday I would’ve been happier. Anyway, it worked out for me — both airlines sent me flight vouchers (SWA sent me a $250 one) and I got home fine. I just won’t fly SWA to New England during the winter.

Reviews: Not Verified |  My husband had been an A-List member of Southwest Airlines for over 20 years. He traveled extensively for his work and we always appreciated the special perk he received of priority boarding due to his status. When Covid hit and all airlines came to a halt, his company put a moratorium on all travel - even after the airlines were back up and running. Last fall he received a promotion from Southwest that if he traveled one round trip flight anywhere, he could retain his A-List status. Unfortunately, he had been diagnosed with cancer back in the spring of 2021 and began undergoing cyberknife treatments in September 2021. His doctors specifically told him he should not travel through the remainder of the year as he was immunocompromised. We contacted Southwest and let them know the situation. The agent with whom I spoke advised that if we could provide a certification from his oncologist, they would consider our request to extend his status despite the fact he was unable to travel even the bare minimum in 2021. Yesterday, after going through a second appeal process following an initial denial of our request from Southwest, we were told they would not be able to honor our request. I am absolutely appalled that this airline, which our entire family has supported religiously for the past 20 years (in addition to all of my husband's business travel), would not consider these extenuating circumstances and grant him an exception. Shame on you Southwest for not having more heart. Perhaps if someone in a leadership role is faced with the same daunting cancer diagnosis and finds themselves undergoing this brutal treatment, they'll reconsider this ridiculous policy. We couldn't be more disappointed at this time in the airline and its leadership.

Reviews: Not Verified |  We were flying on March 21, 2022 from Maui to Honolulu at 1.30 pm. It was a very hot day and my 8 year old daughter was very thirsty. The water fountain at gate 13 was broken so I told her we get water in the plane. It was a 30 minute flight so I knew there wouldn’t be service during flight. We were at the back of the plane, it was completely empty and I saw a male and female flight attendants at the back, 4 seats away from us. They were boarding the front of the plane. My 8 year old went to asked the lady for water very politely and she turns to my kid and says "No, sit down" in a very rude way. My kid came back so I went and asked the gentleman if he could please give me some water for my kid. He literally reached in front of them on a cart and gave me a blue can of water. I said to the lady, "my kid just wanted water and it was right in front of you, that was mean" she followed me to my seat and said something, I said the water was right in front of you. She raised her voice and said "Do we have a problem here?" At that moment I figured she wanted to get a reaction out of me, maybe to kick me off the plane so I said "no, no problem, I’m sorry". Never flying this airline again. Inhumane to a child that all she needed was a cup a worker.

Reviews: Not Verified |  My nonstop flight at 3.50 pm Sunday March 13th from Dallas to Tulsa was cancelled 24 hours before flight time. I received an email which I later found meant no text notification. They auto booked me for 10.00 pm flight, then was delayed two hours, which puts me getting home at 1.30 am. No apologies, no explanation was given, weather is one thing but cancelling a fight because you didn’t sell enough seats is terrible customer service. Especially when I’ve been a loyal client for decades. I was really disappointed with this company. Way too many delays and cancellations in the past year. Covid is over and no longer an excuse. My time is way more valuable than buying an inexpensive plane ticket. I will be finding a new carrier when my points and funds are gone. So sad what’s happening to them. Will not recommend anymore.

Reviews: Not Verified |  I never book flights on low cost airlines with very high hopes. It started when I got to the gate, the staff was nice and they are enforcing very strict COVID rules, something very important in these times. Before long we were boarding, which was surprisingly easier than with other airlines. You got to choose your seat, which was nice (as long as your preferred seat wasn’t already taken), and the taxi and takeoff was smooth and uneventful. Once we had leveled off, the cabin crew came around with drinks and snacks, and while their selection was a little limited, I understand why they can’t have a vast array of refreshments. The cabin crew was very nice, and while there was no in flight entertainment, I don’t see that as a factor that lowers the experience value because it’s just so easy to bring your own entertainment on board these days. Our descent, landing, and taxi were smooth, and once we got to our gate, I exited the plane feeling refreshed at the experience I had just had.

Reviews: Not Verified |  My review is for the Southwest staff at the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport. It wasn’t crowded. There were no long lines. And yet every desk employee was rude, grumpy, non-smiling, and abrupt. My questions were met with sour looks, wrong information (it turned out), and I have MS and although I don’t appear disabled, I walk with great difficulty. My husband was with me. We needed a wheelchair. There were no pushers at all and we were treated like it was too much to ask or expect. We weren’t blaming Southwest about the wheelchairs but that is who we had to ask for it. But that wasn’t a main issue. The desk agents in arranging our new flights treated us like scum under his feet, he made mistakes, instead of answering our questions he said “You’re done so move away.” My husband was trying to push my wheelchair, I was rolling my carry on beside me, my tote on my lap, my husbands back pack We had been stuck in Phoenix 2 nights due to weather. We were smiling, respectful, polite and understanding…on purpose. It didn’t help. He again told us to get out of the way quickly. In 2 days, back at the airport, after our new flight didn’t show on the APP, waiting on hold 3 hours, never receiving the previously requested call back, Finally we got an email with the flight confirmation. The desk agent had no one else in line, and couldn’t find us in the computer. My husband looked up the email with the confirmation to show her and she rudely said ”I don’t want to see any phones. Don’t show me papers (we hadn’t). You aren’t booked.” We were but somehow she couldn’t find us until she tried for over 10 minutes. Not sure if it was system or human problem. Ok so no wheelchair pushers on duty so that was a wreck. I’m pushing 2 carryons beside my wheelchair, husband is carrying 2 items plus pushing. We get to security. No help at all. An agent said we needed a pusher and to go to the information desk and ask them to call for a pusher through security. The info man said ”I don’t know who told you that but I don’t do that.” So security was a mess. I can’t walk or stand long enough. I needed to stay in my chair. I was greeted with sour looks and impatience. when they asked if I could try to walk through the scanner. I can’t. And I can’t help my disease.  I waited a long time before a woman security person came to get me through. I didn’t mind waiting. I did mind being spoken to in such a rude manner. Because we had to check out of the hotel 6 hours before our flight, we had several hours to wait at the airport and gate. And the list of rude Southwest staff went on. I’ll stop here.

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | RNO-LAX r/t. As always, at least for us, Southwest is the best carrier out of Reno. Flight out was delayed by 30 minutes but we were kept well informed. In fact it turned in to only a 20 minute delay and an on time arrival in LA. Check-in, boarding and flight all went smooth. Served a drink and snack. Protocols for Covid were in place for the one hour flight which is no problem. Shocking airport traffic in the terminal at LAX for a Thursday evening but that has nothing to do with the airline. Flight out of LAX was remarkably smooth. Departure at 10.35 am and literally lifted off in air at 10.36. Arrived 15 minutes early in Reno. Used my points so flight was free except for $5 in taxes. Can't beat it. Good job Southwest.
Route: Dallas Love Field to Orlando, FL

Reviews: ✅ Trip Verified | Great price for airfares, but you pay for it with their customer service. They are lazy, do not take time to help their customers, and are selfish with their time. I was recently in Dallas airport and called the desk because their agent had made a mistake with my ticket. I accidentally left my AirPods at the desk. I boarded my plane and noticed they were missing. I quickly checked the location and called the desk. I explained I was already on the plane, so that I couldn’t get off. We had about 75 people still boarding, and the door was still open. The agent at the desk, said if I have time, I will walk them to your gate. (This was at gate 4/6, and I’m at gate 10, not far at all) of course, she did not have time, and now I’m being told I have to pay for FedEx to have them shipped back, and that’s if they are found. It’s so sad that they encourage laziness and the lack of customer service.
